title: If Jhin MUST go bot, who would best support him?
body:
I have only laned with him once or twice and found him to be wanting in the laning department. You know the old MEME, their Jhin (beast) vs. OUR Jhin (pussycat). But even laning against him i found the ability to be marked by the support to be the most troubling thing. IT is like being double rooted. Short of that, I think he is Highly gankable and a jungler should have a field day with him. SO I figure a good supp for him should be someone with good peel. I don't think we will be seeing him in kill lanes from what I have seen. 

What are your opinions?

replies.body:
Hey Occams Raiser,

So I love Jhin, I do not think he's being used to his fullest potential but he opens a lot of windows to lanes. With Morgana, she can use W and Jhin can then snare which would lead into a Morgana snare and it gets really punishing. Same with a Nami bounce heal it can give Jhin great poke. They both also have great peel as a black shield and Nami is a peel factory. Let me know if you can come up with some great combos also.

Honestly, he's probably going to be better solo lane or jungle when used to his fullest right now. That's something I kind of like, because he's awesome and I hate playing ADC.

In this meta a low DPS carry doesn't really seem to have a place, looking at Sivir for an example, and his damage profile is just so bursty and conditional, I don't know if a duo lane will work the way he is now. At least not with the way teams are currently being drafted. 

Two threat teams just seem to do better, but non-adc carries seem to get hit as they pop up so that may change as there become fewer toplane carry options that aren't ADC's with safe or strong lane phases.

>That's something I kind of like, because he's awesome and I hate playing ADC.

Hey now, an ADC does not mean bot lane :P

Jhin is going to function relatively the same, and can serve the same role in a team no matter where he goes. Do you just hate duo lanes in general? It seems like a lot of marksman are being made/remade so they can function solo, so we players can start moving away from the whole "bot=ADC" mentality.

I can see some AP champions working bot, but nobody wants to try.

Well, Jhin has good poke, so he goes well with poke supports, however this presents the problem you mentioned before: he has no escape.

This is why a kill lane is where Jhin would probably be more at home. You may be thinking, "A kill lane, isn't that even more risky?" Well, actually... not really. Most supports that make for a good kill lane partner have cc to lock people down with. Just take Leona for example; her whole KIT is cc. So, Leona is good, Morgana is pretty good, Lux, Annie, maybe Blitzcrank... all of those ought to be good with Jhin because they have some peel for him, and can lock people down and force them to take massive damage to the face, and while they're busy being tossed around, this cc is going to mark them, so Jhin can combo cc them in place for a million fucking years, so I'd say good comp. I have played a lot of jhin and here are my thoughts on the following supports that I have played with: 
{{champion:432}} is not bad. His heal/speedup is very good for jhin and as always bard's ult is game changer. 
{{champion:53}} is very good. Unfortunately the only game I played with blitz our jungler decide to troll because I picked jhin.... You set up a trap under blitz, blitz waits on it, pulls someone, you w, person dies. It is pretty funny. 
{{champion:201}} is not as bad as you would expect. Braum himself will generally apply 2 stacks of his passive so you can usually proc the passive. It will be extended fight so if you playing jhin you will need to have some good decision making when playing with braum. Would not recommend playing whith braum unless you have a few games as jhin already. 
{{champion:40}} is ok. I personally don't particularly like janna support. The shield and peel is nice but it just feels lackluster. 
{{champion:89}} is not bad. Provides a good engage for you. However doesn't provide any peel. In an all in situation 2v2, she is pretty good with jhin. However jhin won't be able to proc leona's passive effectively (like most adc's, unless you are corki). 
{{champion:25}} is pretty good. Morgana has an obvious synergy with jhin. Double snare is pretty powerful. And she provides peel when needed. 
{{champion:267}} is very good. I might be a little biased because nami is my favourite support to play but jhin and nami is very strong. She provides everything jhin needs, speed ups, heals, poke, hard engage, and a hard disengage. 
{{champion:111}} is very good. I played one game with him and we reeked. It was so strong I felt bad for the vayne/nami lane we went against. On a side note, you do not want to play jhin vs a naut support. 
{{champion:16}} is a {{champion:16}}. She is going to heal you..... that's pretty much it. Oh and right, there are some nice plays with her silence and your w. She silences them and you root right away.
{{champion:44}} is actually pretty good. His stun is impossible to miss and he provides you with a heal and surprising amount of damage.
{{champion:412}} is okay I think. I didn't lane with a good thresh yet, but from the ones I laned with it seems pretty good. I mean he provides lots of cc to chain with your w so he should be pretty good, as long as he lands hooks.
{{champion:26}} is pretty good. I liked laning with him. The speed up is pretty nice and his ult is still probably the best ult in the game.

TLDR
{{champion:53}} {{champion:267}} and {{champion:111}} are my favourite supports for him.

I used to main {{champion:40}} .
In her current state, I would be afraid to take her to lane at all.

Explain why?  She's still very efficient, has the highest pick rate (behind Thresh) and highest win rate in the support role.  She is FAR from being able to carry, but her kit allows her to make plays, reset fights, or prevent plays from being made.  She just lacks damage, which is made up for with her damage-by-proxy.

She's far from unplayable. I know very well how good she **_can_** be.

For myself, I never really recovered after they nerfed the range (and width) on her Q. (it now has to charge up before it has its full range)

I used to rely on that ridiculously long range, along with her shield and high MS, to constantly harass my lane opponents, and alow my adc to farm safely, with zero worries. Arguably, I might have also been overextending and relying on Janna's great disengage to not be punished for it.

I'd currently be afraid to lane with her, not because she is bad (she's not) but because I know my former playstyle wouldn't work.
In context to this, my original comment was probably very misleading.
